questions.questionText: Five athletes P, Q, R, S and T compete in a race. The table shows the finishing times for theathletes. athlete P Q R S T finishing time / s 22.50 24.40 25.20 26.50 23.20 Which statement is correct?

options.A: Athlete P won the race and was 0.70 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.B: Athlete P won the race and was 1.90 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.C: Athlete S won the race and was 1.30 s ahead of the athlete in second place.
options.D: Athlete S won the race and was 2.10 s ahead of the athlete in second place.

questions.questionText: Which statement about acceleration is correct?

options.A: It is related to the changing speed of an object.
options.B: It is the distance an object travels in one second.
options.C: It is the force acting on an object divided by the distance it travels in one second.
options.D:
It is the force acting on an object when it is near to the Earth.

questions.questionText: Which statement correctly describes the effects of placing a heavy load in a car?

options.A: It is easier to accelerate the car and easier to bring the car to rest.
options.B: It is easier to accelerate the car but more difficult to bring the car to rest.
options.C: It is more difficult to accelerate the car and more difficult to bring the car to rest.
options.D: It is more difficult to accelerate the car but easier to bring the car to rest.

questions.questionText: Water has a density of 1000 kg / m^3.

options.A: The resultant force on the satellite is zero.
options.B: The resultant force on the satellite is towards the Earth.
options.C: The resultant force on the satellite is away from the Earth.
options.D:
The resultant force on the satellite is in the direction of motion.

questions.questionText: The diagram shows a solid block resting on a bench. The dimensions of the block are shown. 80 cm^ bench 20 cm 40 cm ### P R ### Q On which labelled surface should the block rest to produce the smallest pressure on the bench?

options.D: P, Q and R produce the same pressure

questions.questionText: Two copper containers P and Q are filled with hot water. The diagrams are both drawn to the same scale. ### P Q

options.A: The surfaces of P are painted white and the surfaces of Q are painted black.
options.B: The surfaces of P are shiny and the surfaces of Q are dull.
options.C: The surfaces of P have a smaller area than the surfaces of Q.
options.D:
The water in P is hotter than the water in Q.

options.A: The speed of light in glass is equal to the speed of light in a vacuum multiplied by therefractive index of glass.
options.B: The incident angle of a light ray at an air-glass surface is the angle between the ray and the glass surface.
options.C: The sine of the critical angle at an air-glass surface is equal to (^) refractiveindex^1 ofglass.
options.D: The angle of refraction for light passing through an air-glass surface is proportional to the angle of incidence at that surface.
